channel.title: [REQ] Need a TuT for Lagless World Objects [REQ]
channel.description:
Well, I don't use an Object Handler, I spawn all my Objects through Case 210 using ReplaceObject2. Well, I've been working on a large project lately, and it has required a LARGE Amount of Object Spawning. The Project is success, but theres a Slight Problem - Whenever I hit a Load Point, I get about 7 Second Lag EVERYTIME the Load Point is hit. I'm thinking that whenever I hit a Load-Point, it reloads all the Objects I spawned, and I was wondering if anybody has a TuT that would somehow remove the lag, Keep the Objects spawned in that area, Or make the Objects spawn only when you enter the Specific area that the Objects are spawned on.
Any help would be appreciated.
Thanks.

item.title: [REQ] Need a TuT for Lagless World Objects [REQ]
item.dc:creator: @Zamorakian Zamorakian
item.description:
@Zamorakian wrote:

Woot!

After experimenting with Voids and Case 121, I have figured out how to make the Objects spawn only when I enter the Area that they are in.

Thanks for your help anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Need a TuT for Lagless World Objects [REQ]
item.dc:creator: @Zamorakian Zamorakian
item.description:
@Zamorakian wrote:

Added all my Object Spawns Between {} in the NewObjects Code.

Added

NewObjects();

Right Above

break;

under Case 121.

Using:

ReplaceObject2(AbsX, AbsY, ObjectID, Face, ObjectType); Replacefloor(AbsX, AbsY, ObjectID, Face); AddGlobalObj(AbsX, AbsY, ObjectID, Face, ObjectType);

@Zamorakian wrote:

I am Spawning over 250 Objects. and I’m trying to keep them from Re-Spawning everytime I hit a load point.

Read full topic
item.source: [REQ] Need a TuT for Lagless World Objects [REQ]

item.title: [REQ] Need a TuT for Lagless World Objects [REQ]
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

search for

case 4:it will look something like this …

case 4: ReplaceObject2((objectX - 1), objectY, objectID, Face, 0); server.objectHandler.ObjectType[ArrayID] = 3; break; } }somewhere below that add(if you don’t already have it)

public void AddGlobalObj(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) { for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) { if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) { person.ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType); } } } } }and directly under that add

public void NewObjects() {}then search for

case 121:it will look something like this

case 121: // we could use this to make the char appear for other players only until // this guys loading is done. Also wait with regular player updates // until we receive this command. // println_debug("Loading finished."); break;right above

break;add

NewObjects();

now go to public void newobjects and in the {} use this format

AddGlobalObj(objectX, objectY, ItemID, Face, ObjectType);

objectx is the x coord
objecty is the y coord
itemid is the id of the item
face is the direction the object will be facing
and object type is the type of object it is

some stuff you might want to know
FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration

adding NewObjects in case 121 reduces lagg significantly

Read full topic
